Name: Kneeling Statue of Isis-Sereket
Description: This statue represents the goddess Isis kneeling and holding on her lap a small figure of the mummy of Osiris on a rectangular tablet. She wears one of her typical headdresses, the hieroglyphic sign for "throne," which also means Isis. A scorpion is engraved on the front of the headdress. This emblem associates Isis with the scorpion goddess Sereket. Isis is sometimes depicted with a scorpion perched on her head because seven scorpions protected her when she was searching for the body of her husband Osiris.
